Dear Imagine Families,
Thank you for all the remarkable work you have been doing this year, especially during these last nine weeks of the 2019-2020 school year.
Why not close out the school year with this exciting event? NASA begins a new era of human spaceflight as American astronauts will once again launch on an American rocket from American soil to the International Space Station. While they may not be able to welcome us in person, they have invited us to join them virtually to Kennedy Space Center to witness this historic launch. Launch is scheduled for 4:33 p.m. EDT on Wednesday, May 27. Register to let them know you’re in, and NASA will keep you up to date! You’ll get a chance to interact with NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine and Kennedy Space Center Director Robert Cabana on the day before launch. You can find out more information to prepare for launch day at NASA.
Go to NASA Stem Engagement for STEM Launch Kits and other NASA STEM @ Home projects.

Setting goals is a great way to measure progress and gives us a target to work toward. Be SMART when planning your goals, at any age.

SMART goals are:
✅ Specific. What is it that you want to accomplish?
✅ Measurable. How will you know when the goal is accomplished?
✅ Attainable. Is it realistic?
✅ Relevant. Does this goal meet a need?
✅ Time-bound. What is the deadline for meeting this goal?

Attendance is important ... this month and every month!
Why?: http://ow.ly/YWDI30lVo0o

Thank you to everyone who encouraged and monitored regular school attendance during National Attendance Awareness Month. Proper attendance will help prepare scholars for success. When students are absent for fewer days, their grades and reading skills often improve. They also develop healthy life habits and feel more connected while developing important social skills.

Set expectations for your students to succeed through the rest of the school year.

#NationalAttendanceAwarenessMonth

Fall and back-to-school often bring more visits to the doctor, dentist appointments, after-school activities and never-ending errands. WHEW.

Having a visible, organized calendar the whole family can check daily will help ease the confusion. Adding color codes to your calendar for specific items offers an extra layer of organization.
♦️ TEACHER TIP: Not everyone has to be everywhere; include the initials of each family member that must be included next to certain events or tasks. If your family shares a digital calendar just ensure when items are added it updates on all devices.
👇
More tips to help organize your calendar: http://ow.ly/voMg30lVoOk.

A popular question we receive from prospective parents is: “Why are public charter schools important?"
👇
Through our charter, we earn operational autonomy to pursue specific educational objectives regarding curriculum, staff and budget. We are also held accountable to the same (or often higher) standards of district public school peers. So, essentially, public charter schools provide a more custom education fit to your child’s needs!

Interested in learning more? Contact us for a campus tour.
Learn more about public charter schools: http://ow.ly/3Ox030lVogv.
